title: Equipment Type Schema
description: Standardized enumeration of all possible equipment types in The Shadow Team Chronicles universe, categorized by function and purpose.

categoryMapping.description: Grouping of equipment types by their functional category (not part of the enum, provided for documentation)

weapons.description: Items primarily designed for combat and inflicting damage.

armor_protection.description: Items designed to protect the wearer from damage or harm.

apparel.description: Items worn primarily for practical, cultural, or aesthetic purposes rather than protection.

magical_items.description: Items that channel, contain, or produce magical effects.

technological_items.description: Items that utilize advanced technology to provide specific functions or capabilities.

tools_utilities.description: Practical items used to perform specific tasks or functions.

special_equipment.description: Specialized items for specific scenarios, activities, or professions.

valuable_items.description: Items primarily valued for their monetary worth, rarity, or cultural significance.

descriptions.description: Detailed explanations of each equipment type (not part of the enum, provided for documentation)

melee_weapon.description: Weapons designed for close-quarters combat that require direct physical contact, including swords, axes, maces, and daggers.

ranged_weapon.description: Weapons that can strike targets at a distance, such as bows, crossbows, firearms, and energy weapons.

thrown_weapon.description: Weapons designed to be thrown by hand, including throwing knives, shurikens, javelins, and grenades.

ammunition.description: Consumable projectiles used with ranged weapons, such as arrows, bolts, bullets, energy cells, or spell components.

light_armor.description: Protective gear that offers basic protection with minimal restriction to mobility, such as leather armor or reinforced clothing.

medium_armor.description: Protective gear that balances defense and mobility, such as chainmail, scale armor, or tactical vests.

heavy_armor.description: Protective gear that prioritizes maximum defense at the cost of mobility, such as plate armor or powered exoskeletons.

shield.description: Defensive implements held or mounted to block attacks, including bucklers, riot shields, and energy barriers.

helmet.description: Protective headgear that may include additional features like enhanced vision, communications, or environmental protection.

clothing.description: Standard garments worn for practical, cultural, or aesthetic purposes, which may include special properties or hidden features.

footwear.description: Shoes, boots, or other foot coverings that may provide protection, enhance movement, or serve specialized functions.

accessory.description: Supplementary items worn or carried that enhance appearance or provide minor functional benefits, such as belts, gloves, or scarves.

jewelry.description: Decorative items worn on the body that may also contain magical or technological enhancements, such as rings, amulets, or circlets.

magical_focus.description: Items used to channel, direct, or enhance magical abilities, such as wands, staves, orbs, or spell components.

magical_artifact.description: Objects imbued with significant magical properties or powers, often unique or legendary in nature.

technological_device.description: Advanced equipment that uses scientific principles to perform specific functions, from simple gadgets to complex machines.

cybernetic_enhancement.description: Technological augmentations that interface with biological systems, providing enhanced capabilities or replacing lost functions.

implant.description: Devices installed within a body to provide internal enhancements, monitoring, or specialized capabilities.

tool.description: Implements designed for performing specific tasks, crafts, or professional activities, from lockpicks to surgical instruments.

utility_device.description: Multi-purpose items designed for practical use in various situations, such as multi-tools or environmental scanners.

medical_item.description: Equipment used for diagnosing, treating, or preventing injuries and ailments, from bandages to advanced regeneration devices.

communications_device.description: Equipment for transmitting or receiving information across distances, including radios, communicators, and telepathic enhancers.

surveillance_equipment.description: Devices used for monitoring, recording, or gathering intelligence, such as cameras, microphones, or magical scrying tools.

navigation_equipment.description: Items that assist with wayfinding, mapping, or tracking movement, from compasses to holographic positioning systems.

container.description: Items designed to hold, transport, or store other objects, which may have special properties like expanded capacity or preservation.

vehicle_component.description: Parts or accessories for vehicles that may enhance performance, add capabilities, or repair damage.

mount_equipment.description: Gear designed for animals or creatures used for transportation, including saddles, barding, or control interfaces.

ritual_item.description: Objects used in ceremonial or magical procedures, often requiring specific preparation or conditions for use.

musical_instrument.description: Devices that produce music or sound, which may have cultural significance or magical/technological properties.

scientific_instrument.description: Equipment used for observation, measurement, or analysis in scientific or scholarly pursuits.

data_storage.description: Devices that contain, protect, or transfer information, from scrolls and books to digital drives and neural storage.

concealed_weapon.description: Weapons designed to be hidden or disguised as ordinary objects, allowing for surprise attacks or bypassing security.

trap.description: Devices designed to be triggered by specific conditions to harm, capture, or impede targets.

disguise_kit.description: Collections of tools and materials used to alter appearance and identity, from makeup to holographic projectors.

forgery_tools.description: Specialized equipment for creating convincing copies or falsifications of documents, seals, or other authentication methods.

climbing_equipment.description: Gear designed to facilitate vertical movement and secure positioning on various surfaces and terrains.

survival_gear.description: Equipment that supports basic needs in harsh or wilderness environments, such as shelter, fire-starting, or water purification.

currency.description: Items that serve as a medium of exchange, store of value, or unit of account within economic systems.

treasure.description: Valuable items prized primarily for their worth rather than functional use, such as gems, precious metals, or collectibles.

cultural_artifact.description: Objects of significant historical, religious, or cultural importance that may confer social benefits or access.

wearable_tech.description: Technological devices designed to be worn on the body that provide information, enhancements, or specialized functions.

consumable.description: Single-use items that are expended when activated, such as potions, drugs, stimpacks, or spell scrolls.
